etymology.description: Depicts two intersecting lines, often used to represent change or transformation.
etymology.interpretation: The character 爻(爻) (yáo, "false, change") depicts intersecting lines, symbolizing the concept of crossing and transformation as seen in the Yijing or Book of Changes.

examples.chinese: 在卜筮中(在卜筮中)，爻代表着变化的可能性(爻代表著變化的可能性)。
examples.pinyin: Zài bǔ shì zhōng, yáo dài biǎo zhe biàn huà de kě néng xìng.
examples.english: In divination, the yao represents the potential for change.

examples.chinese: 他研究易经爻辞(他研究易經爻辭)，探讨虚实界限(探討虛實界限)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yán jiū Yì jīng yáo cí, tàn tǎo xū shí jiè xiàn.
examples.english: He studies the yao texts of the I Ching and explores the boundary between reality and illusion.

examples.chinese: 爻的变化反映天命(爻的變化反映天命)。
examples.pinyin: Yáo de biàn huà fǎn yìng tiān mìng.
examples.english: The change of the yao reflects destiny.
